course.subject: HART
course.name: Introduction to Experimental Animation
course.description: This introductory course aims at guiding students to explore the art of animation through producing drawing, cut-ups, roto-scoping, photographic and object animation with digital and traditional tools. By introducing non-mainstream techniques and mediums for creating time-based imagery, students will learn both practical skills and theories of animation as a visual art form for artistic expression and communication. Through brief lecturing, students will acquaint themselves with the history and development of experimental animation and its influences to moving image arts in general. The hands-on activities will allow students to explore freely the principles of animation starting from manual techniques such as simple flip-books and zoetropes. Students will also learn to create animation from common computer software, such as Photoshop and Aftereffect.

reviews.author: JunePumpkin
reviews.comment_content: The course teaches about basic knowledge about different types of animation, like flipbook animation and stop motion animation, etc. We learn how to make our own animation during lessons (most likely create simple animation through computer). But it would be better or easier to follow if you have some computer skills in apps like Photoshop, or else it would be a bit hard for students to understand the steps.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor was quite willing to answer all kinds of questions about animation, including those topics that were not covered in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
overall the grading is quite okay, not too high or not too low.
I made a flipbook animation and got a B+ at last.
reviews.comment_workload: It totally depends on which type animation you chose for the final project. I chose to make a flipbook animation through ipad, and drew about 2000 pages in total, this took me about a whole month to complete my animation.

reviews.author: ciserein
reviews.title: 建議放棄reg呢個course嘅想法
reviews.comment_content:
上課基本上都係睇下過往一啲大師嘅實驗動畫，大部份都算常見？所以呢一部份唔係非常重要。
然後每堂都會有會有"workshop"要你係要求之內完成一啲動畫，都唔係好難嘅，上堂可以好隨便，完成咗佢要你做嘅嘢就ok
不過呢你就唔會係呢個course到學到任何動畫制作嘅skills，而係多概念上嘅嘢
reviews.comment_teaching: Jamsen其實好用心去答問題嘅，基本上你落咗堂留低問佢同動畫相關嘅嘢佢都好願意詳細解答，小至同個課程相關嘅嘢，大至你自己對動畫制作嘅未來想法或者搵緊自己嘅art style佢都會答你
reviews.comment_grading:
呢個course嘅評分準則
- mid-term project 30%
  一份對一個自選嘅short animation嘅800 words review，簡單嚟講即係essay，因為成件事好空泛所以做嘅時候好迷茫，都唔知自己方向啱唔啱
- final project 40%
  一段好重要嘅自制動畫，workload重嘅罪魁禍首
- class participation 20%
  上堂做嘅所有workshop嘅表現
- attendance 10%
上堂plz

本人final grading係B+，我個人覺得grading冇話非常差，而且自知自己個final project做爛咗所以B+都好合理。不過grading同 credits 同佢個workload好唔合理以致只想俾個C佢。
reviews.comment_workload: 真係好辛苦嘅一個course，佢個workload甚至大過3creds 嘅course，我覺得佢可以係一個3creds course......即使我係有畫畫底同做動畫嘅底我都覺得好辛苦，熬咗幾日夜去做份final project。所以諗清楚先好reg呢個course

reviews.author: L7MP
reviews.title: Play with Animation
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction to different kinds of animation
Intro to making simple stop-motion animation
Intro to making simple hand-drawn animation
Final Project: make a 1-min animation (any kind)
It doesn't teach you to make animation professionally. It's just a course in which you can have fun making or 'playing with' simple animation. If you are interested in this, then you are welcomed to take this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: The Instructor is passionate on teaching. He gives very useful comment on our animation works. He is patient when you seek help from him. Very good instructor.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% Attendance
20% Class Participation
30% Mid-term Essay
40% Final Project (=5% Proposal of your project + 10% First Draft + 25% Final Project)

Mid-term Essay has no relation to what you are taught. Just write the essay yourself.
I don't know how they define "good" or "bad" for Class Participation and Final Project. Although they have a form for this, I think the grading is somehow randomized. Maybe It's not correct to say this, but that's how I feel.
reviews.comment_workload:
Heavy Workload for a 1-credit course.
You have to write a essay and do some animation(which is very time-consuming).
For final-project, you have to first do a proposal and prepare for a presentation about your plan on your project. Then you will do the first draft, which is like a simple version of the final work. After these you do the final work. This can be very time-consuming. You need a month for this project, and you are required to draw hundreds of pictures to make your hand-drawn animation. Other kinds of animation requires similar workload.
